headline: Realty Income Prices €1.3 Billion Dual-Tranche Offering of Euro-Denominated Senior Unsecured Notes
summary: Realty Income Corporation (Realty Income, NYSE: O), The Monthly Dividend Company®, today announced the pricing of a public offering of €650 million of 3.375% senior unsecured notes due June 20, 2031 (the "2031 notes"), and €650 million of 3.875% senior unsecured notes due June 20, 2035 (the "2035 notes"). The public offering price for the 2031 Notes was 99.568% of the principal amount for an effective annual yield to maturity of 3.456%, and the public offering price for the 2035 Notes was 99.552

raw.headline: Realty Income Prices €1.3 Billion Dual-Tranche Offering of Euro-Denominated Senior Unsecured Notes

The public offering price for the 2031 Notes was 99.568% of the principal amount for an effective annual yield to maturity of 3.456%, and the public offering price for the 2035 Notes was 99.552

headline: Realty Income (NYSE:O) Announces Monthly Dividend Increase To US$0.27 Per Share
summary: Realty Income (NYSE:O) recently announced an increase in its monthly cash dividend, raising it from $0.2685 to $0.2690 per share, just as the company's share price registered a 2% rise over the past week. This dividend boost, signaling confidence in continued stable returns, occurred amid a generally positive market environment, with broader indexes such as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq achieving notable gains due to optimistic inflation data and positive updates on US-China trade negotiations...

headline: Forever Dividend Stocks: 5 Income Stocks I Plan to Never Sell
summary: Brookfield Infrastructure and Brookfield Renewable plan to increase their dividends by 5% to 9% each year.  Realty Income has raised its dividend 130 times since coming public 30 years ago.  Enterprise Products Partners has increased its distribution for 26 straight years.

headline: What to Expect From the May US CPI Report
summary: The US CPI report is expected to show core inflation up 0.3% in May as investors watch for signs of the trade war's net impact on inflation. Michael McKee has a preview on Bloomberg Television....
